warmup_exercises.setup_notes: Stand next to a wall or support for balance.
warmup_exercises.execution_notes: Swing one leg forward and backward in a controlled manner. Perform 2 sets of 10 swings per leg.
Perform squats with a focus on depth and control. Perform 2 sets of 10 reps.
Rotate your hips in a circular motion, first clockwise, then counterclockwise. Perform 1 set of 10 circles each direction.

exercises.setup: Position the barbell on your upper traps. Stand with feet shoulder-width apart.
execution: 1. Grip the barbell with hands slightly wider than shoulder-width.
2. Unrack the bar and step back, setting your feet shoulder-width apart.
3. Keep your chest up and core engaged.
4. Squat down by bending your knees and hips, keeping your back straight.
5. Lower until your thighs are parallel to the ground.
6. Push through your heels to return to the starting position.
exercises.weight: Choose a weight that allows for 8-10 reps with good form, typically 60-75% of your one-rep max.
exercises.alternative_exercise: Hack Squat: Provides high quad tension with less setup.
exercises.alternative_exercise_weight: Select a weight that allows for 8-10 reps with good form, similar to the Barbell Back Squat.
exercises.additional_tips: Focus on maintaining a stable posture and a proper bar path throughout the movement.

exercises.setup: Sit on the ground with your upper back against a bench and a barbell over your hips.
execution: 1. Roll the barbell over your hips and position your feet flat on the ground, shoulder-width apart.
2. Drive through your heels to lift your hips until they are fully extended.
3. Keep a neutral pelvis and squeeze your glutes at the top.
4. Lower your hips back to the starting position in a controlled manner.
exercises.weight: Select a weight that allows for 10-12 reps with good form, focusing on glute contraction.
exercises.alternative_exercise: American Hip Thrust: Offers similar benefits with a different setup.
exercises.alternative_exercise_weight: Choose a weight that allows for 10-12 reps, focusing on glute contraction.
exercises.additional_tips: Ensure your upper back remains in contact with the bench throughout the movement for stability.

exercises.setup: Start with the bar on the ground. Pick it up like a regular deadlift for the first rep.
execution: 1. Stand with feet hip-width apart, holding the barbell with an overhand grip.
2. Keep your chest up and shoulders back.
3. Push your hips back while keeping your knees slightly bent.
4. Lower the barbell along your legs until you feel a stretch in your hamstrings.
5. Return to the starting position by driving your hips forward.
exercises.weight: Choose a weight that allows for 8-10 reps with good form, focusing on the hip hinge movement.
exercises.alternative_exercise: Stiff-Legged Deadlift: Similar movement with a focus on hamstrings.
exercises.alternative_exercise_weight: Select a weight that allows for 8-10 reps, focusing on the hip hinge movement.
exercises.additional_tips: Maintain a flat back throughout the movement to avoid lower back strain.

exercises.setup: Position one foot on a bench behind you.
execution: 1. Stand a few feet in front of a bench and place one foot on it.
2. Keep your torso upright and core engaged.
3. Lower your body by bending the front knee until the thigh is parallel to the ground.
4. Push through the front heel to return to the starting position.
exercises.weight: Choose a weight that allows for 10-12 reps with good form, focusing on unilateral benefits.
exercises.alternative_exercise: Lunges: Offer similar benefits with less setup.
exercises.alternative_exercise_weight: Select a weight that allows for 10-12 reps, focusing on unilateral benefits.
exercises.additional_tips: Focus on balance and control throughout the movement to maximize effectiveness.

exercises.exercise_name: Smith Machine Front Foot Elevated Lunge
exercises.setup: Position the front foot on an elevated platform. The back foot should be placed comfortably far back, standing on the toe for balance.
execution: 1. Stand with your front foot on an elevated platform and the back foot on the ground.
2. Hold the Smith machine bar with both hands.
3. Lower your body by bending the front knee, keeping most of the weight on the front foot.
4. Pause at the bottom, then push through the front heel to return to the starting position.
exercises.weight: Choose a weight that allows for 10-12 reps with good form, focusing on the elevated position.
exercises.alternative_exercise: Walking Lunges: Offer similar benefits with more dynamic movement.
exercises.alternative_exercise_weight: Select a weight that allows for 10-12 reps, focusing on dynamic movement.
exercises.additional_tips: Ensure to rest between switching legs to avoid systemic fatigue.
